result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Milton A. Snider Jr.

records.addlTxt:
It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  L.G. or 235 Monroe St N, Hudson, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:15 PM CO: TCH for RMW, RPR: Melstrom, Clerk: Lindabaur Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah Harrelson in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Milton A. Snider Jr. in court. DE confirms address. Court advises of charge and possible penalties. Waive reading. NG plea. Reserve on pre-plea rights. DE doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets PSC.  gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
